snippet: The U.S. Institute for Supply Management said its index of national factory activity fell to 48.2 from 48.6 in November and is now at its lowest level since June 2009.
abstract: Institute for Supply Management reports index of national factory activity fell to 48.2 in December from 48.6 in November, its lowest level since June 2009; Commerce Department reports construction spending for November dropped 0.4 percent from 0.3 percent rise in October.
lead_paragraph: The U.S. Institute for Supply Management said its index of national factory activity fell to 48.2 from 48.6 in November and is now at its lowest level since June 2009.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Manufacturing Falls for a 2nd Straight Month
